    The Army App You Need

    The Army App You Need

    my_army_app.Rmd
    library(pkgrpArmy)

    Introduction

    This is a package that will mainly generate a shiny-app (web application) to allow you simulate the military physical test for to be prepared for the real one. The purpose of the package is to allow users to have an introduction to what can be a preparation to see which army class they can be associated with after the military phisical test.

    Inside the App

    points_army

    Contains all the information regarding the the possible points obtainable from specific results in different exercises.

    Performances

    Contains the possible army class of affiliation resulted from the total points sum of each exercise.

    Convert

    It generate a radar-chart based on your result in each category of military exercise preparation listed in “point_army”. This radar chart is basically a summary of your results in every category.

    Orientation

    This function will generate a data-set that is then used during the creation of the radar-chart explained before in the “Convert” paragraph.

    militaryapp

    This function is used to recall and generate a shiny app. This shiny app is a Military app regarding “Performance Scoreboard for Recruitment”, that use all the functions and data-sets mentioned before to create our final output.
    The app is entirely in English with exercises explanation, video (in French) and also a connection to the website of each military classes directly from the final table.
    The purpose of our application is also to be as much user-friendly as possible and we tried to make it really easy to use. So to get the final result the user has just to set the result obtained in each exercise with a slider, this will immediately update the radar chart, with the “total points” section, shown under the sliders and the table on the side of the chart that is containing the military classes.

    On this page

    Developed by Jacopo Beghetto, Alistair Bisol, Andrea Ferrazzo, Manoel Pidoux.

    Site built with pkgdown 2.0.7.
